timeline.bodyText: How about using NullableTime for the OAS "time" type instead of plain "string" type? At least specifically for go-experimental, because this would be a breaking change for "go". Golang has the time.Time.Truncate() function, which could help to perform arithmetic with dates.
timeline.author: sebastien-rosset

timeline.bodyText:
Why not invoke the following code in go-experimental processOpts() instead of modifying the dataType here? What is the reason for changing the type in postProcessModels()?
typeMapping.put("DateTime", "NullableTime");
timeline.author: sebastien-rosset

replies.bodyText: Agreed with using typeMapping to directly map the type instead of using the code above.
replies.author: wing328

replies.bodyText: So interestingly, adding typeMapping.put("DateTime", "NullableTime") does not produce the same output for the samples. I wonder if that was done on purpose. When the dataType is set in postProcessModels(), it does not have the same effect as when typeMapping is invoked in processOpts(). Is that done on purpose?
replies.author: sebastien-rosset

replies.bodyText: We only want to represent the DateTime object as NullableTime if it's marked as nullable in the spec. I don't think we should use it in all cases.
replies.author: bkabrda
sebastien-rosset

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I agree this PR is ok as-is, let's keep more changes for followup PRs.
replies.author: bkabrda

replies.bodyText:
We only want to represent the DateTime object as NullableTime if it's marked as nullable in the spec. I don't think we should use it in all cases.

Thanks for the explanation. I have added code comments to explain.
replies.author: sebastien-rosset

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, I agree this PR is ok as-is, let's keep more changes for followup PRs.

Thanks. Can you approve the PR then? Approving in the text does not help much. BTW, for some reason I am unable to add you as a reviewer.
replies.author: sebastien-rosset

replies.bodyText: Approved. Sorry, I keep forgetting doing the official review.
replies.author: bkabrda
